abstract: Airlines have been making changes in their frequent flier programs, increasingly giving their best rewards not just to passengers who fly the most but who also pay the highest fares.
snippet: Some airlines are awarding points in frequent-flier programs based on the cost of travel rather than the distance.
lead_paragraph: Some airlines are awarding points in frequent-flier programs based on the cost of travel rather than the distance.

headline.main: Airlines Focus Rewards on Those Who Pay More
headline.seo: Airlines Focus Their Rewards on Those Who Pay Higher Fares
